Articles.Content:
Hello. I'm trying to launch KSP with some mods, and it crashes just at the loading screen. What's funny - I have 8GB of RAM, how'd it go depleted so quick? Here are the mods I'm using:

-Aviation Lights,

-Chatterer,

-Collision FX,

-DMagic Orbital Science,

-Engineer Redux,

-Final Frontier,

-Firespitter

-Hull Camera,

-Kerbal Attachment System,

-KAX (Kerbal Aerospace Expanded?),

-Science Alert,

-KW Rocketry,

-Modular Rocket Systems,

-NEAR,

-Probe Control Room,

-Procedural Fairings,

-SCANsat,

-Smart Parts,

-Snacks,

-Sounding Rockets,

-Stage Recovery,

-StationScience,

-Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz,

-Universal Storage (with Snacks and KAS modules),

-USI allmods pack,

-Vessel Viewer.

And here's the Crashlog:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/14cmsou2xrx8kgl/output_log.txt?dl=0

I'll be happy to receive any help I can get.

Short answer: install Active Texture Management. You can also try the -force-opengl and -popupwindow flags, but they may not work well on your system.

KSP 32-bit application, so even on 64-bit Windows, it's limited to about 3.5 GB of RAM. Although there is a 64-bit version of KSP for Windows, right now career is broken and it's often highly unstable. You could try installing Linux on an external drive Ã¢â‚¬â€œ that 64-bit version is relatively stable and most mods work on all platforms.

Works like a charm! Thank you

Got the Active Texture Management installed, and it loaded for ages at first, but now the load times are extremely short!
